name: ListUserIssues
description:
Fetch issues and pull requests assigned to you.

Lists issues and pull requests across owned and member repositories assigned to the authenticated GitHub user. Useful for tracking tasks assigned to you. Includes both issues and pull requests, distinguishable by the `pull_request` key.

parameters.name: issue_filter_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of issues to return. Options: 'assigned', 'created', 'mentioned', 'subscribed', 'all'.

value_schema.description: Indicates which sorts of issues to return. `assigned` means issues assigned to you. `created` means issues created by you. `mentioned` means issues mentioning you. `subscribed` means issues you're subscribed to updates for. `all` or `repos` means all issues you can see, regardless of participation or creation.

parameters.name: issue_state
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return open, closed, or all issues.

value_schema.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return.

parameters.name: label_filter
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of label names to filter issues by. Example: 'bug,ui,@high'.

value_schema.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: `bug,ui,@high`

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Choose sorting method for results: 'created', 'updated', or 'comments'.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specifies the sorting direction of the results, either ascending (`asc`) or descending (`desc`).

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: updated_since
parameters.description: Show issues updated after this timestamp. Use ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

value_schema.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of issues or pull requests to return per page. The maximum allowed value is 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: result_page_number
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the results to fetch. Use for paginating through result sets.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
